This article is about the empty cup for a standard cup of tea. For the empty cup used for tea in Player-owned houses, see Empty cup (clay).

An empty cup is an item that is obtained after drinking a cup of tea or a cup of nettle tea. To obtain an empty cup, players can buy or steal a cup of tea from the tea stall in east Varrock. Having a conversation with Galahad will also involve him giving the player a cup of tea, after which it can be drunk to get an empty tea cup.

Contents

  • 1 Uses
  • 2 Products
  • 3 Item sources
    • 3.1 Spawns
    • 3.2 Shop locations
  • 4 Changes
  • 5 Trivia

Uses[edit | edit source]

The only use for an empty cup is to fill it up with standard tea, nettle tea or turn it into a Guthix rest potion after completion of the One Small Favour quest. To refill the cup with standard tea, players must use it on a tea flask with at least one dose in it. To refill the cup with nettle tea, players must use it on a bowl of nettle tea. To create a Guthix rest potion, a player must add a bowl of hot water to the cup and then add a harralander, a marrentill and 2 guam leaves.

Players can purchase empty cups from the Culinaromancer's Chest in the basement of Lumbridge Castle, after completion of the Recipe for Disaster sub-quests the stock will increase. This is the fastest method of obtaining empty cups on an Ironman account. For players who have little to no access to the Chest, Wistan in the Burthorpe general store has a stock of 20 empty cups.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
29 March 2004
(update)

The item became permanently available with the launch of RuneScape 2.

1 December 2003
(update)

The item was added to the RuneScape 2 Beta.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The empty cup is the only item other than the bucket that can be filled from a well, despite a cup of water being a useless item.

[[File:Empty cup detail.png|left|130px]]
An '''empty cup''' is an item that is obtained after drinking a [[cup of tea]] or a [[Cup of tea (Nettle tea)|cup of nettle tea]]. To obtain an empty cup, players can buy or steal a cup of tea from the [[tea stall]] in east [[Varrock]]. Having a conversation with [[Galahad]] will also involve him giving the player a cup of tea, after which it can be drunk to get an empty tea cup.

==Uses==
The only use for an empty cup is to fill it up with standard tea, [[nettle tea]] or turn it into a [[Guthix rest]] potion after completion of the [[One Small Favour]] quest. To refill the cup with standard tea, players must use it on a [[tea flask]] with at least one dose in it. To refill the cup with nettle tea, players must use it on a bowl of nettle tea. To create a Guthix rest potion, a player must add a bowl of hot water to the cup and then add a [[harralander]], a [[marrentill]] and 2 [[guam]] leaves.

Players can purchase empty cups from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]] in the basement of [[Lumbridge Castle]], after completion of the [[Recipe for Disaster]] sub-quests the stock will increase. This is the fastest method of obtaining empty cups on an Ironman account.
For players who have little to no access to the Chest, [[Wistan]] in the [[Burthorpe]] general store has a stock of 20 empty cups.
